column4: Israel's Bezeq Telecom controlling shareholder loses board control
column5: JERUSALEM  April 29 Shareholders in Bezeq Israel Telecom as expected voted for a new board of directors that removed the controlling shareholder's majority and paved the way for an overhaul of Israel's largest telecoms group.

column4: BRIEF-Baidu Enters Definitive Agreements To Divest Financial Services Business
column5: * BAIDU ENTERS INTO DEFINITIVE AGREEMENTS TO DIVEST ITS FINANCIAL SERVICES BUSINESS

column4: Breakingviews - T-Mobile and Sprint pitch America First 5G deal
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - T-Mobile US and Sprint are pitching an America First 5G deal. The mobile operators agreed on Sunday to merge to create a more powerful competitor to market leaders Verizon and AT&T. Antitrust concerns stymied earlier talks  but T-Mobile US Chief Executive John Legere said the deal would create rural jobs and keep the country ahead of China in the 5G race. That’s likely to appeal to President Donald Trump’s regulators.

column4: UPDATE 6-T-Mobile  Sprint say $26 bln deal would give U.S. tech lead over China
column5: April 29 T-Mobile US Inc and Sprint Corp said on Sunday they had agreed to a $26 billion all-stock deal and believed they could win over skeptical regulators because the merger would create thousands of jobs and help the United States beat China to creating the next generation mobile network.

column4: Deutsche Telekom leverage to increase on T-Mobile-Sprint deal
column5: FRANKFURT Deutsche Telekom  said its leverage would increase beyond its target corridor as a result of the takeover by its unit T-Mobile US  of Sprint Corp   but will return to the comfort zone in 2021.

column4: Deutsche Telekom leverage to increase on T-Mobile-Sprint deal
column5: FRANKFURT  April 29 Deutsche Telekom said its leverage would increase beyond its target corridor as a result of the takeover by its unit T-Mobile US of Sprint Corp  but will return to the comfort zone in 2021.

column4: T-Mobile agrees to acquire Sprint
column5: April 29 T-Mobile US Inc agreed on Sunday to acquire peer Sprint Corp  in an all-stock deal that will combine the third and fourth largest U.S. wireless carriers and is expected to attract regulatory scrutiny over its impact on consumers.

column4: German regulator may require cable operators to open networks to third parties - FAZ
column5: FRANKFURT Germany's regulator is considering requiring cable TV operators to provide network access to third parties  in a shift that could affect talks on a European merger between Vodafone and Liberty Global.

column4: German regulator may require cable operators to open networks to 3rd parties - FAZ
column5: FRANKFURT  April 29 Germany's regulator is considering requiring cable TV operators to provide network access to third parties  in a shift that could affect talks on a European merger between Vodafone and Liberty Global .

column4: Ex-Wynn Resorts CEO files defamation lawsuit against former employee - WSJ
column5: Steve Wynn  who resigned in February as chief executive of Wynn Resorts Ltd  following allegations of sexual misconduct  has filed a defamation lawsuit against a former employee of the casino company  the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.

column4: Ex-Wynn Resorts CEO files defamation lawsuit against former employee-WSJ
column5: April 28 Steve Wynn  who resigned in February as chief executive of Wynn Resorts Ltd following allegations of sexual misconduct  has filed a defamation lawsuit against a former employee of the casino company  the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.

column4: Logistics leader Prologis to acquire DCT Industrial for $8.4 billion
column5: NEW YORK Prologis Inc    a logistics company with a global footprint  will acquire smaller U.S. rival DCT Industrial Trust Inc  in an $8.4 billion all-stock transaction  including the assumption of debt  the two companies said on Sunday.

column4: Telecom Italia CEO says his position 'untenable' if Elliott wins board majority
column5: MILAN Telecom Italia (TIM) CEO Amos Genish said his position at Italy's biggest phone group would be "untenable" if activist fund Elliott manages to win the majority of board seats at a shareholder vote on Friday  according to a newspaper interview.

column4: Walmart attempts international turnaround with UK  India tie-ups
column5: NEW YORK Walmart Inc's  urgency to stem market share losses to rivals around the world is driving it to partner with local players in the UK and India  even as it scales back in some other markets like Brazil.

column4: Walmart attempts international turnaround with UK  India tie-ups

column4: Sainsbury's  Walmart's Asda to create UK supermarket powerhouse
column5: LONDON Sainsbury's and Walmart's Asda are in talks to create Britain's biggest supermarket group  a combination which would surpass Tesco's grocery market share and be worth up to 15 billion pounds ($20.7 billion). | Video
